intro: Fagara djalma-batistae, commonly known as the Djalma-Batista fagara, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
